J'ai hésité longtemps avant d'acheter DBD alors que je n'avais aucune raison de ne pas le prendre... Pourquoi ?
Je me pose moi-même la question à l'heure actuelle.
Dead By Daylight est très addictif, franchement, je prends un plaisir incroyable sur le jeu.
Pour ma part, je joue surtout en tant que Survivant avec des joueurs discord (communautaire) et j'adore !
Je vous conseille d'éviter de jouer avec des PU (joueur hors groupe) car le gameplay sera moins intéressant à mon avis.
Surtout que pour une fois la communauté Française (sur le discord où je suis actuellement) est très cool et bienveillante.
Tu apprends rapidement grâce au conseillé des autres.
Comme défaut sur le jeu, je ne serais en citer actuellement car tout joue sur le gameplay du Tueur, s'il camp, slug ou tunel pour ce qui coco. Cela peut vite devenir dégoutant dans une game. Mais bon, ce n'est pas une raison de ne pas aimer le jeu. 
Niveau contenu(s) vous avez de quoi faire ! Le farm de lvl de personnage afin de débloquer les capacités, les défis (avec des bonnes récompenses), le niveau du compte (avec prestige), fin bref, il y a de quoi faire ! 

Dernier point, pour rassurer certains joueurs qui ont peur de la répétitivité dans le gameplay, j'en avais peur aussi !
Mais pour être franc, au final, le gameplay ne se répète pas car chaque game est différente car grâce aux différents survivants/tueurs dans le jeu, les perks (compétences), cela change énormément le jeu. Ce qui est très satisfaisant.

Je vous conseille largement le jeu. C'est une pépite !
Très bon jeu, gameplay novateur et attrayant, ne peut etre que conseillé.
Игра хорошая, но оптимизацию бл*ть завезите уже наконец
игра мертва, ебал её в рот

Dans l'ensemble, DBD est un jeu vraiment fun pour jouer avec des amis ou seul avec de parfaits inconnus  
Néanmoins l'un des points négatifs du jeu est sa communauté, en effet pour y avoir joué 88h, j'ai remarqué qu'environs une game sur trois vous imposera une communauté toxique de joueur qui se déconnecte, de tueur qui camp ou qui tunnel qui sont au final des choses plutôt fréquentes lors des parties.
Ajouté à cela la la différence de rang, que ce soit coté tueur ou survivant (par exemple : la possibilité de tomber sur 4 survivants rang irrité alors que votre rang max est bronze ;) )
Malgré cela il reste un jeu de coopération et de survi fort agréable à jouer les 3/4 du temps.
C'est également pour ça, que je vous le recommande fortement mais de préférence pour jouer avec des amis.

This game is awesome. Dead By Daylight is fun to play with friends, or alone. Some things in this game such as perks can take some time to understand, but as long as you enjoy playing the game, then soon enough it will come to you. I highly recommend this game.

Fredbear's Family Diner
William Afton and Henry opened in 1967 the family friendly Fredbear's Family Diner, featuring a brown furry suit of a bear as a mascot. Henry would usually wear the suit, as they didn't have enough money to hire someone to do the job for a long time and they were studying at the time. William studied engineering and Henry business adminstration and communication.

William met an unnamed woman, with whom he married and three years later had a boy challed Michael. They met in the court; William was being charged for murdering a child that allegedly was crying outside the Diner for being scared of Fredbear, the bear, and she was working selling hot-dogs in from of the building. (Btw, he was released because they didn't have evidences pointing it).

It took them four years to actually achieve any success with the Diner, as they learnt from little Michael that Fredbear was boring. William them designed a new mascot: a yellow furry suit of a rabbit called Bonnie. The chemistry between both characters worked like black magic and the success rained on them like rain in a rainy day.

The amount of money they got was so much, William used it to test his engineering skills, designing the first two Spring Lock suits: which were obviously Bonnie and Fredbear. The success increased.

Freddy Fazbear's Pizza
The Diner's success was so big, a company decided buy it and open a franchise around it. Hanry and William sold it, seeing a whole lot of profit coming from it, but there was a catch: the company used sneaky legal actions that allowed them to have the diner 100% under their possession, erasing Henry's and Michael's name from it. The company then opened Fazbear's Entertainment to take care of everything.

William was so pissed because of this he cut any relationship with anyone involved with the franchise. Henry, on the other hand, didn't know any other thing to do, so he asked for a job; he became Phone Guy.

FFP opened in 1973, and featured four furry suits of animals: Freddy Fazbear, a recolour of Bonnie, Chica and Foxy The Pirate. This made William even more pissed when he learnt they made four animatronics without him. He started planning his revenge.

Btw, the Diner was still opened - as a sister location for FFP.

The Origin of Purple Guy
In 1976 William had twins: a little blonde girl and a little brunette boy. He started to teach Michael to take care of them, because "Daddy won't be around forever".

During his free time, William started designing and projecting new robots (he hated the name "animatronics") and plans for his own company: Afton Robotics. But he had another plan under his sleeve: ruin FFP from the inside.

He disguised himself as Dave Miller and started working applied for day time security guard at FFP. As he was always wearing purple - the uniform's colour - and usually hid in the shadows to stay out of sight of anyone who might recognize him, he was nicknamed by every child as "The Purple Guy".

During this time, in 1980, he did his evil plan: using the Spring Bonnie suit he built years earlier, he lured five children to a back room, murdered them and hid inside the body of the animatronics. In case you're wondering what he did with the fifth one, he obviously hid it inside a spare Freddy suit he then painted yellow, duh.

Fortunately for Billy, they actually caught Henry instead of him, as one of the cameras caught him walking around in one of the suits. He got out sometime later, as they managed to prove he had some mental disabilities and had a fixation with wearing the suits around, and had no violent behaviour.

But Dave? Well, he was fired when FFP closed.

Circus Baby
With the help of the money he got from selling the children's organs in the black market, William opened Afton Robotics and had everything ready to open his own kid-friendly restaurant: Circus Baby's Pizza World. The problem is that he got a new hobby, and this where his hill went down.

He liked so much the idea of killing children and the profit he could get from selling their organs - healthy children organs are way more valuable than adults' -, he made special alterations in his robots, turning them into kid-kidnapping and killing machines.

The problem is that, in 1982, he accidently let his daughter get close to Baby when he wasn't looking; and Baby killed her. He knew he was the one to blame, but he actually blamed Michael for this, saying that he, as the older brother, should've protected her.

This incident lead to the pizzeria's cancellation and William's divorce. His wife took Michael and the other boy with her, leaving him alone. His new hobby and this incident in his life lead him to become a human monster.

The Children
Going a little away from the entire "Afton story arch", let's talk about the children he murdered. The first one came to possess a Puppet from FFP. The other five, with the help of the first one, possessed the suits they were stuffed inside. They then started killing any adult they could at night, when there was no children around, because they thought every adult was the "Purple Guy" they heard of when they were still alive.

The Bite of '83
William's ex-wife took the children and they started living close the Diner, that was still running great. For the good old times, before the problems, she would take them there.

William, on the other didn't like it in the slightest, and bought a warehouse close to their house, where he built an underground room he used to monitor cameras installed in the house, the Diner and in the street. He also started to prepare the warehouse to building Circus Baby Entertainment & Rental. He also returned to his Dave Miller persona, working at the Diner, taking a closer looka at his sons.

The Crying Child
After the Baby Incident, Michael became a rebel teenager who, rebelling against his father's will, bullied his younger brother. For the brother's unluckiness, he was also traumatized for actually having witnessed Baby killing his sister in the year before.

For his luckiness, though, he had a reliable friend: Psychic Friend Fredbear. Unbeknown for him, the plush was actually a camera his father used to check on him. More unbeknown for him, when the plush talked with him, it was actually the spirit of his sister, who was haunting William's warehouse, and with supernatural abilities managed to speak through the camera system.

The Bite per se
You all know how it happened. Birthday party, bad joke, head inside the bear's mouth and chomp, child's head's crushed. He went to the hospital, but died. His sister tried to help him, but in the end he became a ghost purple bear, crying in the corners of anywhere the suit that killed him was at.

William's Revenge
After the Bite, Michael's mother committed suicide and he was taken under William's keeping. But Billy wasn't happy with his son, who caused the death of another one of his children.

William projected the new building to have a place for torturing children - specially made for Michael, actually. The room was designed to mimic Michael's room from the other house, so when he would fall asleep, William would take him to the "nightmare" room (Michael would be drugged) and unleash nightmarry robotic versions of the Fazbear animatronics to haunt him at night, giving him some reminders of what he did to his brother. This marked Michael for life, and turned him a better person, actually.

1987
OMG, this is long, isn't it?

Well, in 1987 another FFP opened, with new animatronics. William became Dave again and killed more five children. The place temporarily shut down, reopened in November, but didn't last after Mangle bit someone. Henry was once again without a job.

This game has a verry special gameplay, I've never seen anywhere else. It allows for a multitude of different play styles and for me personally is very fun. Also the game manages to create a competitive gameplay experience that isn't based on reaction time, but rather on strategy and includes a lot of mind games, which is a really nice diversion from all the FPS Shooters.
It's rather something for those who plan to play video games rather regularly as it has a pretty steep learning curve in the beginning and also a lot of content is behind DLC paywalls, though the content it comes with is already worth several hundred hours. I have the game for about 3 years now and am playing for about 350 hours now (excluding AFK and menu time) and I still haven't mastered a single killer.

The one big problem I have with the game though is that the matchmaking is a little broken now and then. It's already a lot better than where it has been before, but there is still some room for improvement as you sometimes get matched with total hardcore players and the other game you get a bunch of newbies.  Now that there is an MMR system this has become less and less, but it still sometimes feels pretty unrewarding.

So in my opinion you should definitely give it a try, as it is an incomparable experience. And if you don't like it, you could always refund it, though 2 hours are probably not enough to get a good impression.

Addictive, and challenging. This game is a blast solo, or even more extreme fun in a custom game with friends. Killer or survivor, you will be met with different challenges and solutions. A living breathing adrenaline pumping game of hide and seek, wrapped around a daring puzzle with some challenges sprinkled in. 10/10 for sure. Get it today, you need this in your life. Trust me.

Horrible game.  When you play survivor they camp and run no ed.  When you play killer they are hacking, gen rushing, and flaming you in chat.  I have nightmares about no ed, DS, BT, DH, and insidious.  If your friends get this game for you, they hate you.  Also gives you Neurodivergent powers like the virgin virgin fruit.

Like any multiplayer game its better with friends so you can be in the same voice chat. Being able to tell each other where the killer is or guide people towards exits is really helpful. You start out with like 6 survivors and killers, the rest you need to buy. You get points from each match to buy skills for each character. The skills help you live longer but if you know how to bob and weave you can manage without them. Its annoying when killers start face camping but its online, so of course some people are gonna troll on occasion. Play with headphones and practice, you'll get the hang of it.

Une source de divertissement souvent douloureuse.

Rationnellement, je ne saurai dire si j'aime ou si je déteste ce jeu. Il est très addictif et ses problèmes d'équilibrages entachent énormément la notion de plaisir. Toute une palette de personnage (survivants comme tueurs) sont disponibles et/ou déblocables rapidement. Pour Dead by Daylight, il ne suffit pas de payer pour gagner. Il faut enchaîner les parties, évoluer ses personnages, débloquer toujours plus de capacités et continuer inlassablement de s'améliorer. J'aurai tendance à dire que c'est un très bon jeu de coopération si l'on joue survivant, et encore, entre les trolls, les traîtres et les inexpérimentés... il est très difficile d'espérer de collaborer sans se faire discrètement sacrifier.

Du côté des tueurs, le fair-play n'est pas toujours au rendez-vous. Peu de diversité au niveau des capacités utilisées, mais ce n'est pas forcément un problème, bien que je trouve personnellement que ce soit dommage d'un point de vue de l'expérience joueur.

Étrangement, il est estimé que 90% des joueurs de Leatherface sont de véritables cancers sur pattes. Je rêve du jour où... sa maniabilité sera diminuée et que les tueurs se prendront de réelles pénalités lorsqu'ils campent pendant les parties.

P.S. : A tous les joueurs ou joueuses, s'il vous plaît soyez sympa des fois, je sais bien on rigole on rigole mais ou bout d'un moment moi je rigole plus, j'arrive je veux faire un générateur bah non t'es la dernière mon cul, je suis la pour aider un bro bah non t'es toujours la, je vais passer sur un coins de map t'es la et je le sais bien que tu es là 😔 franchement j'aimerai aussi pouvoir faire des générateur ou bien courir dans les champs de blé mais tu m'empêche car tu aime me victimisé c'est ta passion, je t'ai même promis un marcher tu as attendu que je tourne le dos pour m'accrocher... maintenant à cause de toi je me retrouve obliger de me cacher dans tous les casier que je vois car tu la tellement terrifiée. 

Ps+: non je vrai il est fun que j'ai quand le scrimer arrive, attention à pas tomber de votre chaise, ou bien éclater votre souris/ manette, écran ou même bien réveiller les voisin en hurlent de peur mdr.
